page.title: 08GOUROCK HIGHLAND GAMES
page.content: GOUROCK HIGHLAND GAMES IS AN ANNUAL EVENT WHICH TAKES PLACE AT DARROCH PARK IN THE TOWN.THE GAMES WERE STARTED IN 1956 AS AN ATTRACTION FOR HOLIDAYMAKERS,AND NOW TAKES PLACE EVERY YEAR IN MAY.THEY ARE NOW HELD ON A SUNDAY AFTERNOON.THE 1985 GAMES ATTRACTED MORE THAN 5,500 PEOPLE,WHO CAME TO SEE 19 PIPE BANDS,20 HIGHLAND DANCERS,13 TUG-OF-WAR TEAMS,ATHLETICS EVENTS AND 15 STALLS.THE PRESENT CHIEFTAIN OF THE GAMES IS CAPTAIN DUNCAN DARROCH.THE ONLY TIME THE GAMES HAVE NOT BEEN HELD IN RECENT YEARS WAS WHEN THE COMMONWEALTH GAMES WERE ON IN EDINBURGH.
